checkSendAdapterUpdateMsg.label: Adapter update message
checkSendAdapterUpdateMsg.help: Receive a message when an update for an adapter is available

checkSendAdapterUpdateMsgDaily.label: Overview of updatable adapter
checkSendAdapterUpdateMsgDaily.help: Get a message with an overview of all updatable adapter

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the overview of updatable Adapter:

checkSendInstanceDeactivatedMsg.label: Instance deactivated message
checkSendInstanceDeactivatedMsg.help: Receive a message when an instance is deactivated

checkSendInstanceDeactivatedDaily.label: Overview of deactivated instances
checkSendInstanceDeactivatedDaily.help: Get a message with an overview of all deactivated instances

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the overview of deactivated instances:

checkSendInstanceFailedMsg.label: Instance failed message
checkSendInstanceFailedMsg.help: Receive a message when an instance failed

checkSendInstanceFailedDaily.label: Overview of failed instances
checkSendInstanceFailedDaily.help: Get a message with an overview of all failed instances

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the overview of failed instances:

checkSendOfflineMsg.label: Offline message
checkSendOfflineMsg.help: Get message if an device is not reachable

checkSendOfflineMsgDaily.label: Overview of offline devices/services
checkSendOfflineMsgDaily.help: Get a message with an overview all offline devices/services

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the overview of offline devices/services:

checkSendBatteryMsg.label: Battery message
checkSendBatteryMsg.help: Get message if an device has low battery

checkSendBatteryMsgDaily.label: Overview of low battery devices
checkSendBatteryMsgDaily.help: Get a regular message with an overview all low battery devices

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the message of low battery:

checkSendDeviceUpgrade.label: Device update message
checkSendDeviceUpgrade.help: Receive a message when an update for an device is available

checkSendUpgradeMsgDaily.label: Overview of devices with update
checkSendUpgradeMsgDaily.help: Get a message with an overview all devices with update

_textDays.text: Choose the day(s) where you want to get the overview of update devices:

showAdapterNameinMsg.label: Add adapter name in notifcations
showAdapterNameinMsg.help: Will add the adaptername from the device

_msgServiceText.text: Here you can choose your notification service, you can use more than one service, but you can also leave all blank, then only the datapoint lastNotification will be filled.

subjectEmail.label: Subject (optional)
subjectEmail.help: Choose your subject for the Email

userPushover.label: User/Group key (optional)
userPushover.help: Choose your User/Group key for Pushmessage

items.title: Choose which instances should be excluded
Choose which devices/services should be excluded

trueState.label: True State
trueState.help: Use the true value of the signal strength, or it is converted to %

listOnlyBattery.label: List only devices with batteries
listOnlyBattery.help: Choose if only devices with batteries should be listed or all devices

minWarnBatterie.label: From what % battery is considered low

createOwnFolder.label: Create own folders for each adapter
createOwnFolder.help: If you like to have for every Adapter an own folder with own data

createHtmlList.label: Create additionally HTML lists
createHtmlList.help: Create the lists also in HTML

_textUpdateInterval.text: Here you can define the update interval of the datapoints/lists. For performance reasons, it is not recommended to select a poll value that is too low. Lower than two seconds is not selectable.

_textTimeInstances.text: Define the globale error time of the instances. The standard value is 20 seconds.

_textTableTimeInstances.text: If necessary, set the error time of each instance for yourself here. This setting overwrites the global setting for the selected instance.

items.title: Choose which instances should have a longer downtime

_textOfflineTime.text: Here you can define the offline times of each adapter. If you want to use the data points of the devices/services (online, available, reachable etc.) directly to determine the status, enter ' 0 '.
